{"step_by_step_thinking": "Elasticity refers to the ability of a material to return to its original shape after being stretched or deformed. Among the given options, α and β titanium are different phases of titanium and have moderate elasticity. Chrome-cobalt-nickel is a type of stainless steel and is less elastic. Nickel titanium, also known as Nitinol, is known for its superelasticity or pseudoelasticity, meaning it can undergo large deformations and still return to its original shape.", "answer_choice": "D"}
